entry.title: shake it off, stay alive, open wide
entry.summary:
Author: dogfishmonger

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,243Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 55

Summary: He feels like shit when he's hungry, and he plays better when he's empty. The cold air doesn't touch him as much. The floodlights turn silvery-soft.And he likes eating. Keeps his hands busy, mouth busy, mind busy. Something to chew through, putty in the ears.Go until you can't anymore. Cycle it back out. Be ready.  --OR: Buck's had on-again, off-again bulimia since he was 14.--Updates on Wednesdays. Title from Psychic Friend's "We Do Not Belong"

entry.title: This house feels so empty (I'm lost on my own)
entry.summary:
Author: ggmmm4628

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,431Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 7

Summary: A conversation between Maddie and Buck and a conversation between Eddie and his sisters.“What? No. I uh actually moved into Eddie's house.” He says it in such a manner, that not only does he surprise his sister he also surprises himself. It was natural, normal, like it was meant to happen. Clearly, his sister did not agree, the shock palpable on her face.“I’m sorry you did what?” She’d moved from the other side of the kitchen and was now standing right infront him, eye contact unable to be broken.

entry.title: I'm Straight, But
entry.summary:
Author: isthatacatsherlock

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,934Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 142

Summary: “What if I…” Eddie started to say something, then stopped, shook his head. Buck looked over. Am gay? He finished in his mind but didn’t say anything. “It’s silly. It’s stupid. Nevermind.”But it obviously wasn’t nothing, because Eddie kept looking like he wanted to say something, even touching his arm a couple of times. “Get it out, Eddie. Safe space, remember?”“I think this may push the boundaries of safety.”“I guarantee it won’t. We just talked about precome.”

entry.title: Not In The Same Way
entry.summary:
Author: bandhoez9194

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,738Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 29

Summary: "I love you," Buck whispered, Eddie humming sleepily as he rolled over to face him. "Love you too bud," he said half asleep, Buck's entire self shattering.Of course Eddie wouldn't actually want him like that. Who would? They were drunk, Eddie doing whatever it was he was doing before Buck showed up, and Buck just got broken up with.He felt the urge to leave, to protect his heart and self. But longing, selfishness, and mild self hatred had him staying, arms wrapped tightly around Eddie's waist and face buried in his hair. If this was the only time Buck would be allowed to have this, then he'd hoard it. Memorise it so it became engraved in his DNA, much as Eddie himself already had.~~~~~~~~~Or, Buck and Eddie fell into a fwb situation after Buck and Tommy broke up. Buck just wishes Eddie loved him the same way he loved Eddie.

entry.title: all you’ll ever be
entry.summary:
Author: iinryer

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,631Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 59

Summary: “Yeah, yeah, no worries, it’s all good,” Buck laughs as napkins are being shoved into his hands, “just a little spill, no harm d—,”Then he looks up. And it’s—”Oh,” Marisol says.”Oh,” Buck echoes, “uh,”“Um—,” she suddenly looks very alarmed, gaze flicking over her shoulder, scanning the bar, and Buck realizes—“He’s uh, he’s not here,” he rushes to say.Her wide eyes land back on his, blinking away her own shock, but clearly still at a loss.”He’s…,” Buck finds himself continuing, “he’s not here. Anymore. Moved back to Texas. You’re good,”—eddie’s in texas, buck’s handling it poorly. he runs into marisol. turns out the two of them have a few bad decisions of their own to make.

entry.title: Shape Of You.
entry.summary:
Author: Pnk_strawberry1

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,281Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 6

Summary: Eddie Diaz is a renowned professional fighter, celebrated for his power in the ring, and a devoted single father to his son Christopher, who brings immense joy to his life. However, Eddie has a deep-seated dislike for the idea of soulmates and predetermined relationships.On the other hand, Evan Buckley, a brave firefighter, has always held onto the hope of finding his soulmate, and his dreams have been filled with visions of their perfect encounter. So, when he finally meets Eddie on a normal Tuesday call, he is happy, excited, overjoyed, only to discover that his soulmate hates the idea of soulmates and is straight!?Will they be able to overcome their differences and find a deeper connection?———OREddie Diaz, a professional fighter and single father, Evan Buckley a firefighter, Happened to be soulmates! They are meant for each other, right? One problem though will maybe two Eddie Diaz hates Soulmates and is also Straight!?

entry.title: How to supreme an orange
entry.summary:
Author: paleredheadinascifi

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,875Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 393

Summary: "I don’t like oranges.”“Since when?” Eddie frowns. “You used to love oranges.”Christopher shrugs. “I don’t like them anymore.”And that’s fine, really. Tastes change. Christopher doesn’t have to like oranges.It’s just that he does. Christopher loves oranges. Christopher has loved oranges since the first time he tasted one, Eddie watching on over a shaky video call from the desert. Or, Eddie knows his kid, and his kid loves oranges. Buck knows both of them better than Eddie realized. He shows it in various citrus-based ways.

entry.title: I'm Sorry I Left (But It Was for the Best)
entry.summary:
Author: floatyourboat1997

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,451Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 66

Summary: “Man,” he shakes his head with a chuckle. “I haven’t seen one of these since high school.”He drags his palm over the surface of the Ouija Board, flipping the planchette over in his hands a few times before setting it gently in the middle of the board.He sits back on his heels, gesturing to it and looking around the room, like he’ll be able to see Eddie somehow. “Alright, go for it.”The planchette moves immediately, and Buck’s breath hitches. He knew Eddie was here, of course, but it still makes his heart skip a beat to see the little wooden piece gliding over the board without any assistance.I-D-I-O-T+Or: Eddie gets into a car accident on his way home from work, falls into a coma, and leaves Buck behind to pick up the pieces. (The pieces: take care of Christopher, fend off Ramon and Helena, carry out Eddie’s Living Will no matter how much he hates it, and slowly come to terms with his (supposedly) unrequited feelings.) Also, he’s haunted by the ghost of his half-dead best friend the entire time.

entry.title: find me here
entry.summary:
Author: bleedlines

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,297Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 62

Summary: Eddie loads the metaphorical gun, cocks it. “I would’ve found my way to you. That I'm even more sure of.” Buck is burning. That’s the only way he can describe this. Eddie says something like that, and then Buck will end the call, and he’ll crawl into Eddie’s bed in Eddie’s house and stare at the patches in Eddie’s bedroom wall that he helped Eddie patch up, and he’ll pretend like this isn’t going to kill him. He’s entirely convinced he’s going to die before Eddie ever crosses the California state line again. He digs his own grave. “You sound confident for a guy who doesn’t believe in fate.” “Nah, it’s not fate. It’s us and pure determination.” or: eddie moves to texas. buck moves into his place. he holds his breath for the one hundred and twenty one days it takes for eddie to make his way back home.

entry.title: What We Leave Behind
entry.summary:
Author: le_medusa

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,635Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 25

Summary: After four months in El Paso, Eddie begins to question his decision to stay. Christopher keeps asking when they will return to Los Angeles. Meanwhile, communication with Buck has become sparse, and Eddie tells himself it’s just because they’re both busy.That belief starts to crack when Buck calls him one night, full of excitement about a new firefighter at the 118—Tobias Evers, a single father looking for a fresh start. Buck talks about how well Tobias is fitting in, how skilled he is, and even mentions planning a climbing trip with him. Eddie tries to brush it off, but the more Buck talks, the more he realizes how much has changed in his absence.For months, Eddie had convinced himself that things would stay the same, that when he returned, everything would fall back into place. But now, with Buck seemingly doing better without him, Eddie starts to wonder if the life he left behind is still waiting for him—or if he’s already been replaced.

entry.title: More Than Roommates
entry.summary:
Author: PheonixInk

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 760Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 18

Summary: When Buck and Eddie got assigned as roommates their freshman year of college, they became instant best friends. Three years later, Buck still hasn’t realized that Eddie’s been in love with him this whole time. But maybe, just maybe, the truth has been waiting to slip out all along.

entry.title: You’ll Never Get Away From The Sound
entry.summary:
Author: pollutedstar

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,657Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 91

Summary: He warns Chris as best he can, even though he knows he’s seen his father in bad shape before. It’s different this time, though, and they both know it. Chris hasn’t seen Eddie face-to-face in months, and now he’s stuck forever with this reunion, this memory, instead of a man bounding up his parents’ porch to kiss his hair or a dramatic cross-airport sprint for the best hug of his life, and Buck wishes he could fix it but he can’t. So he stays by his side, and they walk into the room together.It’s bad.Eddie’s on a ventilator, a thick tube running out of his throat and an IV hooked to his arm. There’s a catheter placed as discreetly as it can be, but it’s there, along with heartbeat monitors hooked up to his chest, which is thankfully covered by his hospital gown. Neither him nor Chris are ready to see how far the bandages stretch across him, how deep the scarring will run. Eddie, pale and with his eyes closed, looks like a ghost, like a man stretched thin, frozen between life and something else, between LA and Texas, between one half of his heart and the other.

entry.title: "you have no idea how long i‘ve wanted to kiss you" (maybe tomorrow)
entry.summary:
Author: ADOREMAEVE

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 991Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 46

Summary: Eddie Diaz just barely managed to unlock his front door before Evan Buckley nearly topples them both. His full weight was leaning on Eddie’s side, trusting him completely to keep him up. If Eddie wasn’t a firefighter, they would probably be both faced down in the grass right now. Actually no, they wouldn’t have made it out of the bar in the first place.Buck’s breath is warm against Eddie’s neck, and the smell of whiskey was unmistakable, clinging to him, especially in that one spot of his shirt with the liquid dropped down during a shot.“You’re such a mess,” Eddie muttered. He was half amused, half exasperated, as he kicked the door shut behind them. Buck was bordering on tipsy for the whole night, then Eddie leaves for no more than five minutes and suddenly he is like this. It’s almost comical. At least Chimney thought so. AKA , a self-indulged one shot of eddie taking care of drunk buck.
